medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic weakness, inability to walk independently, and severe chronic pain in her head, arms, shoulders, and legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began years ago and have progressively worsened over time; the pain is debilitating. Once in the United States, she experienced further complications, including pain in shoulders and knees.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic pain, mild osteoarthritis of the knees, past nephrectomy for kidney failure, thyroidectomy for large goiter, right salpingectomy for hydrosalpinx, treated for depression and post-traumatic stress disorder.
medical_history.social_history: Born in Somalia, resettled in the U.S. in 2003. Lives in Boston, Massachusetts. No formal education, speaks only Somali, does not smoke or consume alcohol or drugs.
